org.youscope.uielements

Class ImagePanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • org.youscope.uielements.ImagePanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    LiveStreamPanel

    public class ImagePanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    Easy to use resizeable panel to display an image. Provides a convenient method to display the image in a frame.
    Author:
    Moritz Lang
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  ImagePanel.LineInfo
      Information about a drawn line in the image.
      static interface  ImagePanel.LineListener
      Listener which gets informed about a currently drawn line in the image.
      static class  ImagePanel.PixelInfo
      Information about a pixel in the image.
      static interface  ImagePanel.PixelListener
      Listener which gets informed about the currently hovered pixel in the image.

      • setAutoAdjustContrast

        public void setAutoAdjustContrast(boolean autoAdjustContrast)
        Sets if the contrast should be automatically adjusted whenever a new image is set.
        Parameters:
        autoAdjustContrast - True if automatic adjustment should be activated.

      • isAutoAdjustContrast

        public boolean isAutoAdjustContrast()
        Returns if the contrast should be automatically adjusted whenever a new image is set.
        Returns:
        True if automatic adjustment should be activated.

      • setUserChoosesAutoAdjustContrast

        public void setUserChoosesAutoAdjustContrast(boolean userChoosesAutoAdjustContrast)
        Set to true to display a checkbox with which the user can choose on him/herself if the contrast should be automatically adjusted when a new image arrives. Default is false. This does only make sense if it can be expected that more than one image can arrive at all.
        Parameters:
        userChoosesAutoAdjustContrast - True to display checkbox.

      • addControl

        public void addControl(java.lang.String title,
                       java.awt.Component component)
        Adds a component with the given title to the end of the menu containing all controls.
        Parameters:
        title - Title of the control.
        component - The control element.

      • addControl

        public void addControl(java.lang.String title,
                       java.awt.Component component,
                       boolean resizable)
        Adds a component with the given title to the end of the menu containing all controls.
        Parameters:
        title - Title of the control.
        component - The control element.
        resizable - True if the control can take up excess vertical space.

      • insertControl

        public void insertControl(java.lang.String title,
                          java.awt.Component component,
                          int index)
                   throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Adds a component with the given title to the menu containing all controls at the given index.
        Parameters:
        title - Title of the control.
        component - The control element.
        index - index where to add control. Must be greater or equal to 0, and smaller or equal to getNumControls().
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - Thrown if index is invalid.

      • insertControl

        public void insertControl(java.lang.String title,
                          java.awt.Component component,
                          int index,
                          boolean resizable)
                   throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Adds a component with the given title to the menu containing all controls at the given index.
        Parameters:
        title - Title of the control.
        component - The control element.
        index - index where to add control. Must be greater or equal to 0, and smaller or equal to getNumControls().
        resizable - True if the control can take up excess vertical space.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - Thrown if index is invalid.

      • getNumControls

        public int getNumControls()
        Returns the number of controls in the menu containing all controls.
        Returns:
        number of controls

      • removeControl

        public void removeControl(int index)
                   throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Removes the control at the given index.
        Parameters:
        index - index of the control. Must be greater or equal to 0, and smaller than getNumControls().
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - Thrown if index is invalid.

      • removeControl

        public void removeControl(java.awt.Component component)
        Removes a previously added control. Does nothing if control does not exist.
        Parameters:
        component - The control to remove.

      • clearControls

        public void clearControls()
        Removes all added controls.

        public void paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics grp)
        Overrides:
        paintComponent in class javax.swing.JComponent

      • getFrameListener

        public YouScopeFrameListener getFrameListener()
        Returns a frame listener which can be added to the frame to which this panel is added, taking care of all default behavior. Listener is automatically added if toFrame() is used.
        Returns:
        Frame listener.

      • setNoImageText

        public void setNoImageText(java.lang.String noImageText)
        Sets the text which should be displayed if no image is available, yet. Set to null to not display any text.
        Parameters:
        noImageText - Text to display if no images are available.

      • toFrame

        public YouScopeFrame toFrame()
        Convenient method to show this panel in a frame. The frame is not made visible and has a default title.
        Returns:
        The frame containing this panel.

      • setImage

        public void setImage(java.awt.image.BufferedImage bufferedImage)
        Sets the image which should be displayed.
        Parameters:
        bufferedImage - Image which should be displayed.

      • setImage

        public void setImage(ImageEvent<?> imageEvent)
        Sets the image which should be displayed.
        Parameters:
        imageEvent - Image which should be displayed.

      • setTitle

        public void setTitle(java.lang.String title)
        Sets the title of the frame, which is opened by toFrame(). Has no effect when using this panel directly.
        Parameters:
        title - Title of the frame.
